results.title: Magic lantern slipping slide (Le nez d'arlequin - the harlequin's nose)
results.brief_description: Hand painted magic lantern slipping slide ‘Le Nez d’Arlequin’ -‘ The Harlequin’s Nose’ or ‘Punch with Long Nose’ with wooden frame. Manufactured by E.Mazo, Paris. By moving the slipping slide, a harlequin’s nose grows longer and three small children appear on the tip. The words ‘Punch’s Long Nose’ is etched vertically in to the glass plate.

results.title: House in summer magic lantern slide
results.brief_description: Magic lantern slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a English style house and gardens. Several pencil marking on the wood. On the underside, ‘57’ has been written in a thick white ink.

results.title: Total eclipse
results.creator_credit: Agnieszka Holland, Jean-Pierre Ramsay-Levi, Portman Productions and FIT Production
results.brief_description: Agnieszka Holland’s (‘Europa, Europa’) excessive tale about the destructive and passionate affair between French poets Arthur Rimbaud (Leonardo DiCaprio) and Paul Verlaine (David Thewlis) is an intense study of genius and the sometimes maddening nature of creativity. Written by Christopher Hampton (‘Dangerous Liaisons’), ‘Total eclipse’ portrays the two men as being narcissistic sadists, who only take time out from torturing each other in order to torment Verlaine’s timid and unfortunate wife (Romane Bohringer). Cast also includes Dominique Blanc.

results.title: They shoot crocodiles...don't they?
results.creator_credit: Rory McGuinness, Rebecca Scott and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: This documentary provides the viewer with a fascinating insight into how wildlife documentaries are able to capture such spectacular footage. The film follows a year in the life of film makers Rory McGuinness, Rebecca Scott, their daughter Bella, and camera assistant Matt Cadwallader as they set out to film crocodiles, kangaroos and other creatures that inhabit Kakadu National Park. It is revealed as a process involving patience, persistence, nervous energy, and excitement.
